Language: English, Spanish
Title: My Name Is Khan
Original title: My Name Is Khan
Country: India
USA release: 12/02/2010
Released in Spain: 28/05/2010
Released on DVD (rental): 29/09/2010
Producer: Dharma Productions
Director: Karan Johar
Writer: Shibani Bathija, Niranjan Iyengar
Starring: Shahrukh Khan, Kajol, Christopher B. Duncan, Steffany Huckaby, Carl Marino


Synopsis:
Rizwan Khan (Tanay Chheda) is a Muslim child who was raised by his mother (Zarina Wahab) in section Borivali Bombay in India and who suffers from Asperger syndrome. As an adult (Shahrukh Khan), Rizwan falls for an Indian single mother, Mandira (Kajol) who lives in San Francisco. After the attacks of 9 / 11, Rizwan was arrested on suspicion of terrorism by the authorities to suspicious behavior has a reason of their disability. After his arrest, he meets Radha (Sheetal Menon), a therapist who helps them overcome the traumas experienced. Rizwan then begins a journey to find and meet with President Barack Obama (Christopher B. Duncan), in order to clear his name.

Festivals:
Official Selection at the Berlin Film Festival 2010
